thread.title: UK's NEX gets $5.36 billion approach from exchange operator CME

title: UK's NEX gets $5.36 billion approach from exchange operator CME
text:
March 28, 2018 / 3:12 PM / Updated 39 minutes ago UK's NEX gets $5.36 billion approach from exchange operator CME Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Reuters) - Britain’s NEX Group Plc ( NXGN.L ) said it received a 3.80 billion pound ($5.36 billion) approach from U.S.-based exchange operator CME Group ( CME.O ), and added that discussions were at an advanced stage. Men enter the CME Group offices in New York, U.S., October 18, 2017. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid 
NEX said CME made a takeover proposal of 10 pounds per share, which represents a premium of about 3 percent to the stock’s Wednesday close. 
Bloomberg had earlier reported that CME Group was in advanced talks to acquire NEX Group for about 4 billion pounds, citing sources. 
Under UK takeover rules, CME has until April 12 to decide whether to make a bid. Earlier this month, NEX Group said it received a preliminary takeover approach from CME Group. 
CME Group owns the Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT) and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange. 
($1 = 0.7089 pounds) Reporting by Parikshit Mishra and Justin George Varghese in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D'Silva and Shailesh Kuber
